Title: Japanese I
Description: Introductory Japanese. Includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Offered all terms. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Japanese II
Description: ContinuesJAPN 101. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Japanese III
Description: ContinuesJAPN 102. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Japanese IV
Description: This courses includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds on Japanese 103.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Japanese V
Description: This course includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing practice, with a focus on cultural competency and conversational skills. Builds onJAPN 201.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Advanced Writing and Speaking
Description: Provides advanced practice in written and oral communication, including journalistic, professional, and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Introduction to Language for the Professions
Description: Introduction to communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Power and Resistance
Description: Introduction to the analysis of power relations and issues of (in)equality rooted in contemporary political and socio-economic systems. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Language, Media, and Society
Description: Introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Grammar and Translation
Description: Provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Studies in Language for the Professions
Description: Advanced communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Studies in Power and Resistance
Description: Advanced analysis of power relations and issues of (in)equality rooted in contemporary political and socio-economic systems. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Studies in Language, Media, and Society
Description: Advanced analysis of the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. Taught in Japanese.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Independent Study in JAPN
Description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
